newsitem.title: UK: Japanese stocks in London mixed, steels weak.
newsitem.headline: Japanese stocks in London mixed, steels weak.

text.p: Japanese stocks in London were mixed in a generally quiet market on Wednesday, with only steel stocks providing some interest after a string of downwards earnings revisions from steelmakers, traders said.
The Nikkei 50 index in London was barely changed in late trade, up 0.02 percent at 1,374.41 points after the Nikkei in Tokyo closed 3.72 points higher at 20,201.87.
"The steel earnings revisions came after the Tokyo close so we've seen some pressure there. And hi-techs were generally weaker in Tokyo, notably Hitachi," one dealer said.
Traders described market sentiment as gloomy and expected little activity until Friday's release of key U.S. jobs data amid fears of an imminent tightening of U.S. monetary policy.

"Worries about the Fed are still gnawing at the market and particularly that Japan might follow suit. Also, the wrangling over the supplementary budget is not helping investors' mood," a second dealer said.
The second U.S. missile attack on Iraq had no impact on the market and investors appeared confident at present that the conflict would not escalate, traders said.
